name: salt production from seawater, evaporation pond | salt | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21444/documentation

This dataset represents the production of salt from seawater in an evaporation pond in a saline plant by the sea. the location is placed in a warm climatic zone where radiation and wind speed facilitate the evaporation of water. Seawater is driven to the ponds where it is left to evaporate. Salt content increases steadily and salt crystals form naturally. Finally the salt is collected  mechanically. The dataset is constructed using literature and expert judgement. ;Literature: Akridge, D. Glen. (2008). Methods for calculating brine evaporation rates during salt production. Journal of Archaeological Science. 35. 1453-1462. 10.1016/j.jas.2007.10.013. ;;U.S. Geological Survey, 2019, National Minerals Information Center, Commodity Statistics and Information, Salt Statistics and Information. Accessed at 25.06.2019 at: https://www.usgs.gov/centers/nmic/salt-statistics-and-information

Activity starts with the pumping of seawater and depositing it inside the evaporation pond.

Activity ends with the salt being collected and ready for transportation in the saline plant.

exchanges.description:
Based on literature, 9 m2 are necessary to produce 12.5-15 kg of salt considering a salt content in seawater of 3.5%wt. 

Literature: Akridge, D. Glen. (2008). Methods for calculating brine evaporation rates during salt production. Journal of Archaeological Science. 35. 1453-1462. 10.1016/j.jas.2007.10.013.
Each liter of seawater contains 35 g of salt. This is translated into circa 28.5 l of seawater per kg of salt produced.
